Nexium Drug Information

8 Replies Updated March 23, 2018



Conversation Starter

lee Says:
Sat, Jun 18 '05, 10:24 AM

What side effect(s) do you get when using nexium?

REPLYSHAREREPORT


Showing Replies 1 - 8 of 8


Page of 1     Sorted By:
1
Vega Says:
Thu, Jun 23 '05, 3:37 PM

The only one I've experienced after about 1 week is I can't stop eating. Never been a big eater, now I'm always hungry.

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
2
Bonnie Says:
Thu, Jun 23 '05, 7:14 PM

I never had any side effects. I was on it for 4 yrs. I still need it desperately, but can't afford it even w/ medicaid discount.

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
3
Vega Says:
Fri, Jun 24 '05, 7:30 AM

Isn't there something else you could use that's no so expensive?

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
4
Jeannie Says:
Sun, Jun 26 '05, 12:31 PM

PS: Vega, Ur the one that got me thinking of the baking soda, when U wrote on Fri, 6/24/05 if there might be something else to use that's not so expensive... Thank You Vega. U got my head out of the medicine cabinet...U All Have A Blessed Life...

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     1     0  
5
Mark Toussaint Says:
Tue, Mar 28 '06, 10:08 AM

I have been on Nexium 40 mg. daily for 2 years. No side effects or problems have I experenced. I have read that long term use may cause stomoch cancer should I be concerned? If so how do I wheen myself off the drug? Thank You.

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
6
Roseanne8409 Says:
Thu, Apr 29 '10, 2:52 PM

how long does it take nexium to get out of your system

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
7
Bandicoot Says:
Sat, Jun 29 '13, 10:48 PM

Hi, I am in SA and recently found that Citro Soda takes all my acid away- maybe it works for you too, I was also on Nexium and didn't really have any side effects mentioned, except an empty purse....
See my link: home.intekom.com/pharm/adcock/citrosod.html

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0  
8
Marleys ghost Says:
Fri, Mar 23 '18, 12:02 PM via mobile

I have nexium on prescription 20mg twice a day. It is the best thing I have ever taken. 33 years of severe acid reflux is now under control. I cannot praise it enough. As for side effects, I'm on other things too but I tend to blame it all on Co-codamol. I have tried the generic versions and none of them work. I live in England and I don't have to pay for them. I'm on a low income scheme. If you are really suffering please take your tablets. So much better than having a fire in your throat and stomach. Hope it all works out for you all.

REPLYSHAREREPORT
Was this helpful?     0     0

post_text.surface_form: What side effect(s) do you get when using nexium?
The only one I've experienced after about 1 week is I can't stop eating. Never been a big eater, now I'm always hungry.
Isn't there something else you could use that's no so expensive?

PS: Vega, Ur the one that got me thinking of the baking soda, when U wrote on Fri, 6/24/05 if there might be something else to use that's not so expensive... Thank You Vega. U got my head out of the medicine cabinet...U All Have A Blessed Life...

I have been on Nexium 40 mg. daily for 2 years. No side effects or problems have I experenced. I have read that long term use may cause stomoch cancer should I be concerned? If so how do I wheen myself off the drug? Thank You.
how long does it take nexium to get out of your system

Hi, I am in SA and recently found that Citro Soda takes all my acid away- maybe it works for you too, I was also on Nexium and didn't really have any side effects mentioned, except an empty purse.... See my link: home.intekom.com/pharm/adcock/citrosod.html

I have nexium on prescription 20mg twice a day. It is the best thing I have ever taken. 33 years of severe acid reflux is now under control. I cannot praise it enough. As for side effects, I'm on other things too but I tend to blame it all on Co-codamol. I have tried the generic versions and none of them work. I live in England and I don't have to pay for them. I'm on a low income scheme. If you are really suffering please take your tablets. So much better than having a fire in your throat and stomach. Hope it all works out for you all.
